name: places/ChIJs0juepBZwokRu9weA0r6vV8
formattedAddress: 383 Lafayette St, New York, NY 10003, USA
adrFormatAddress: 383 Lafayette St, New York, NY 10003-7011, USA

originalText.text: Very awful service.  People here are not helping or caring for students at all. I am proud to be a NYU alumni but do feel shameful for my school hiring immoral and irresponsible staff at this office. And I believe this is also a concern for most of the students. On the phone, there is an issue I need to escalate to the supervisor, and then the people on the phone provides me with an incorrect number and she claimed this is her supervisor's number. Her attitude for the entire service is very unprofessional. Basically she tries to avoid do any work on her side. And ironically, she repeats multiple times that "I am trying to help", which she basically did nothing. Please don't hire people who don't care about students in an educational organization.

originalText.text: The people who work at NYU registrar are more often than not visibly annoyed that someone dares to ask them for help.  It is hard to find people more dissatisfied and apathetic about their jobs than those who work at NYU, it really is quite amazing.

originalText.text: Ms. Miller went out of her way to help me register for classes. She was polite and very friendly.
